thread.title: F1 Saudi Arabian GP: relive the race won by Max Verstappen - TIme News
thread.title_full: F1 Saudi Arabian GP: relive the race won by Max Verstappen - TIme News

author: time news
title: F1 Saudi Arabian GP: relive the race won by Max Verstappen - TIme News
text:
2024-03-10 02:00:23
19:46
This is the end of this live!
Thanks for following us and see you in two weeks for the Australian Grand Prix!
19:42
The trophy awarded to Verstappen
56th career victory for the Dutchman!
19:38
The top 10 in Saudi Arabia
1. Max Verstappen (Red Bull)2. Sergio Perez (Red Bull)3. Charles Leclerc (Ferrari)4. Oscar Piastri (McLaren)5. Fernando Alonso (Aston Martin)6. George Russell (Mercedes)7. Oliver Bearman (Ferrari)8. Lando Norris (McLaren)9. Lewis Hamilton (Mercedes)10. Nico Hülkenberg (Haas)
19:36
Verstappen: “We managed the gap throughout”
Max Verstappen, speaking to Canal+: “It’s a wonderful weekend for me and for the whole team. The second stint was quite long but we had to make do. The last laps were complicated to manage with the latecomers and the cold tires, but we managed the gap throughout. »
19:33
Leclerc: “Bearman can be proud”
Charles Leclerc, 3rd: “It’s one of the most physical circuits of the championships, it’s really hot, it makes things difficult. Oliver (Bearman, his teammate of the day) did a very good job and deserves to be named driver of the day. He can be very proud. It’s only a matter of time before he gets to Formula 1.”
19:25
Lap record for Leclerc
The Monegasque improved in the last lap and will finish with an additional point.
19:25
VICTORY FOR VERSTAPPEN!
Leading almost from start to finish of this Saudi Arabian Grand Prix, the Dutchman achieved an easy success. He finished ahead of his teammate Sergio Perez, like last week, and Charles Leclerc.
19:25
Verstappen attempts the best lap
Even though he is still on worn tires, the Dutchman tries everything on the last lap to grab an additional point.
19:23
Bearman had
The Ferrari debutant didn’t break down and was still 5 seconds ahead with two laps remaining. He should finish his first GP in a nice 5th place.
19:20
The frozen podium
At the end of a rather boring Grand Prix, Red Bull should win another double. There are three rounds left.
19:17
Bearman must not make mistakes
In seventh position, the beginner saw Lando Norris rushing towards him, but his racing pace was impressive.
19:13
Catastrophic stoppage for Zhou
The Chinese leaves his place in the top 10 to Hülkenberg.
19:11
Hamilton best lap
The Briton is launched, by his own admission, “in qualifying mode”. He has just stolen the best lap from Verstappen and will try to get back on the cars with damaged tires.
19:10
The ranking after 40 laps
1. Verstappen2. Perez +8.83. Leclerc +12.04. Piastri +11.95. Alonso +3.86. Russell +1.47. Bearman +5.78. Norris +5.09. Hamilton + 1.210. Zhou +21.7
19:08
Bearman will have to defend
Nice baptism of fire for the Ferrari replacement, who will have to protect his seventh place in front of Norris and Hamilton, hot on his heels, with new tires.
19:06
Norris in the pits
The Briton, who was in 4th position, wears soft tires. He comes out 8th, just ahead of Hamilton.
19:05
No suspense at the head of the race
Barring an accident or a safety car, we don’t see how Red Bull couldn’t do a double. Perez is 12 seconds ahead of Leclerc.
19:04
Hamilton returns to the pits!
After 37 laps with the same tires, the Briton dived into the pits and came out in 9th position.
19:01
Piastri misses his overtake
The McLaren driver finally had a window to pass Hamilton, but went too far to the outside and blocked the wheels… He remains 6th.
18:59
Battles especially at the back of the peloton
The fight is fierce for 13th place between Ocon, Albon, Tsunoda and Sargeant, currently in that order.
18:57
Norris wants to hold on “as late as possible”
The McLaren driver has still not pitted and has just told his radio that he wants to continue on track as much as possible. Behind him, Lewis Hamilton didn’t stop either.
18:54
The ranking after 30 rounds
1. Max Verstappen 2. Sergio Perez +7.43. Charles Leclerc +9.34. Lando Norris +2.95. Lewis Hamilton +4.46. Oscar Piastri +0.87. Fernando Alsono +4.08. George Russell +1.69. Oscar Bearman +5,710. Nico Hülkenberg +8.8
18:52
Ocon currently 14th
The only Frenchman still in the race, the Alpine driver clings to 14th place, under pressure from Williams. Considering the level of his car, it’s a pretty good result.
18:49
Leclerc takes the podium
It took him a while, but Leclerc finally managed to pass Norris, who still hasn’t pitted, and moved up to third place. The Briton did not try to resist, but had a nice Grand Prix.
18:44
Piastri and Hamilton still in the fight
It’s the soap opera of this Grand Prix for the moment: the McLaren driver is trying somehow to catch up with his elder brother, who is currently impeccable, as we reach the halfway point of the race.
18:42
Norris clings to the podium
The Briton has still not returned to the pits, but is still in third position. Behind, Leclerc is nibbling away by hundredths.
18:40
Verstappen flew away
Unless there is a race, it will be difficult to see the Dutchman again, who is more than six seconds ahead at the head of the circuit.
18:38
The ranking after 20 rounds
1. Max Verstappen2. Sergio Perez +6.23. Lando Norris +3.24. Charles Leclerc +1.35. Lewis Hamilton +3.06. Oscar Piastri +0.57. Fernando Alonso +3.58. George Russell +1.39. Nico Hülkenberg +0.710. Oliver Bearman +5.6
18:36
Perez passed
The Mexican is again in second position. His newer tires made the difference against Norris.
18:34
Brawl between Hamilton and Piastri
The Mercedes and the McLaren are engaged in a tough battle for 5th place and are not doing each other any favors. For now, Hamilton is holding his own.
18:31
Norris under threat from Perez
The second RedBull driver is closing in on second place.
18:30
Bearman in the top 10, Russell 8th
Some movements in the top 10: the young Ferrari driver gained two positions to regain his place in the points. Russell has just overtaken Hülkenberg for 8th place.
18:27
Verstappen deadlock and tete
Norris finally broke down and didn’t insist. The Dutchman, with his hard tires and DRS, is on a completely different pace.
18:24
Perez and Alonso under investigation
The stewards are interested in what happened in the pit lane during the safety car.
18:22
The safety car returns to the pits
The cars are launched again and for the moment, Norris remains in the lead, despite Verstappen’s offensives.
18:22
The ranking after 10 rounds
1. Lando Norris (McLaren)2. Max Verstappen (Red Bull)3. Lewis Hamilton (Mercedes)4. Sergio Perez (Red Bull)5. Charles Leclerc (Ferrari)6. Oscar Piastri (McLaren)7. Fernando Alonso (Aston Martin)8. Nico Hulkenberg (Haas)9. George Russell (Mercedes)10. Guanyu Zhou (Kick Sauber)
18:20
Norris in the lead
The McLaren driver is one of the only ones not to have returned to the pits and is therefore leading the race. His tires are worn so he will have to hope for racing success to hold on.
18:16
Everyone goes back to the stands
The single-seaters take advantage of this safety car to pass through the pit lane. There could be penalties, the situation is quite chaotic.
18:14
Grosse sortie pour Stroll, safety car !
The Canadian shot straight in the last sector, on a big mistake. He has nothing, but his Grand Prix is ​​over. The safety car will enter the track on the seventh lap.
18:13
Gasly: ​​“Sad for the team”
Pierre Gasly at the microphone of Canal +: “Things are not good for us this weekend, we found damage to the car yesterday which cost us Q2 and today I was not able to race. I’m sad for the team, who are doing everything to move forward. »
18:11
Best lap for Verstappen
The Dutchman strings together the best laps at the head of the race and is now 2.5 seconds ahead.
18:09
Perez takes second position!
Great move from Sergio Perez, who passed inside on Leclerc. The Red Bull really seems above the rest. That suits Verstappen, who flies away.
18:08
A second ahead for Verstappen
The Dutchman is trying to get out of the DRS zone, even if Leclerc is holding on well for the moment.
18:06
Bearman in the heat of the moment
The young Ferrari driver, replacing Carlos Sainz, had the opportunity to take his first laps and attacked Tsunoda.
18:05
Gasly already called to the pits
The Frenchman has a problem with his gearbox and will have to retire on the first lap.
18:05
Leclerc attacked by Perez
Big battle for second place, but the Monegasque held on against the Mexican.
18:04
Let’s go !
6:04 p.m., big start for the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix, the lights are out!
18:00
It won’t be long…
The drivers are in their single-seaters and begin their formation lap.
17:49
Whitaker: “No race won for Verstappen”
Martin Whitaker, GP boss, to Le Parisien: “The three previous editions produced three different winners. It’s not at all a race won for Verstappen. We must not forget that it is a city race. The safety car intervened on each edition. This can restart everything. »
17:46
Alpine already in the tough
Esteban Ocon in 17th position on the grid, just ahead of Pierre Gasly: ​​the Alpine team is in immense difficulty at the start of the year and is preparing for a difficult season.
Dismissed engineers, overweight single-seaters… We explain the reasons for this slump in this article.
#Saudi #Arabian #relive #race #won #Max #Verstappen
